unknown_responses.rationale: Contains an explicit low-risk statement ('risk... is low'), triggering Q5.
Describes the patient's condition and future possibility, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes an action being taken: 'officials are taking more samples'.
Describes support for an investigation: 'CDC is also supporting the investigation'.
Contains an explicit low-risk statement ('risk... remains low'), triggering Q5.
Contains an explicit low-risk statement ('risk to most people remains low'), triggering Q5.
Reports a factual condition and feeling, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes response measures: 'officials have been... to deploy a virus-killing spray... and advised all the villagers to report'.
Describes advice/recommendation: 'Pet owners have been advised not to feed'.
Describes advice/recommendation: 'shared advice... on how pet owners can take preventive measures'.
Describes a common practice, not a specific capability or preparedness measure for the outbreak.
Describes advice/recommendation: 'Davis urged pet owners to avoid feeding'.
Describes advice/recommendation: 'take great caution with pets and raw milk'.
Describes advice/recommendation: 'not recommended that anyone... consume raw milk products'.
Describes an action taken: 'FDA conducted additional testing'.
Describes advice/recommendation: 'Ferret owners also should take caution to keep their pets safe'.
Describes susceptibility, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes response measures: 'staff were on the ground to help contain and eradicate the virus'.
Describes ongoing collaboration and support for control efforts: 'CDC continues to collaborate... to support state-run efforts to control the spread'.
Contains an explicit low-risk statement ('risks remain low'), triggering Q5.
Describes recommendations: 'agency recommended that individuals should avoid contact... and not preparing or eating'.
Describes recommendations: 'CDC also recommended... to wear personal protective equipment (PPE)'.
Describes recommendations: 'CDC recommends that if you get sick... contact your local health department and a health care provider'.
Describes a measure taken by authorities: 'Botswana has banned the importation'.
Describes a measure taken by authorities: 'the import... is banned with immediate effect'.
Describes advice/warning: 'authorities warned the public to be vigilant and to report any deaths'.
Describes a measure taken and its purpose: 'chickens and turkeys will be killed in order to prevent the virus from spreading'.
Describes a factor related to preparedness/safeguards: 'Much depends on... improved biosecurity on farms'.
Describes advice/recommendation: 'best way to handle chicken and eggs is to cook them... as a general food safety precaution'.
Describes ongoing work/measures: 'officials were working jointly on additional surveillance and testing'.
Describes ongoing work/development: 'USDA is working with other countries on options for vaccines'.
Describes a measure to be taken: 'authorities will cull 40,000 laying hens'.
Describes measures taken and their purpose: 'authorities try to contain the spread of the disease'.
Describes measures taken and their purpose: 'flock... was killed and was being composted to guard against spread'.
Describes future measures: 'department will test other flocks'.
Describes capability/future possibility: 'could make hundreds of millions of bird flu shots... within months'.
Contains an explicit low-risk statement ('risk... is still low'), triggering Q5.
Describes ongoing development/testing: 'are already developing or about to test sample human vaccines'.
Describes preparedness: 'stand ready to begin production if needed, with existing H5N1 vaccine strains in stock'.
Describes development effort: 'push among companies to develop a bird flu vaccine for poultry'.
Contains explicit framing ('Less reassuring'), not a capability statement without framing.
Describes plans/policy: 'pandemic plans say flu shots should go first to the most vulnerable'.
Describes a framework/plan: 'international framework... allocates 10% of global supply'.
Describes an action/goal: 'WHO is seeking guarantees of 20% global supply'.
Describes agreements/plans: 'agency... has signed legally binding agreements... for 10% of their pandemic flu vaccine'.
Describes details of agreements/plans: 'agreements include six of the largest seasonal flu manufacturers'.
Describes development of mechanisms: 'mechanisms were being developed so that countries can work together... to respond'.
Describes capability: 'have the capacity to make hundreds of millions of doses'.
Describes a process/plan: 'Data on how well the vaccines actually protect... would be gathered in real-time'.
Describes existing resources: 'there are close to 20 licensed vaccines against the broader H5 strain'.
Describes existing resources/capability: 'Existing antiviral treatments... will also help mitigate the impact'.
Describes a potential timeline/limitation, not a capability statement without qualification.
Describes a method/process, not a capability statement without qualification.
Describes advocacy, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes past research/development: 'Moderna's mRNA vaccine research actually began with pandemic flu'.
Describes plans and capability: 'company plans to launch a small human trial... could respond very quickly'.
Describes future action and past outcome, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes awareness and lack of contracts, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes a current limitation/stance, not a capability or preparedness measure.

Describes ongoing studies/research: 'studies are still underway to understand the cause'.
Describes a system/process: 'virus was detected through the state's disease surveillance system'.

Describes measures taken and their purpose: 'property has been placed under quarantine and authorities have established an... zone... in an attempt to stop the spread'.

Describes past events and their consequence, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes a persistent threat, not a capability or preparedness measure without framing.

Describes a measure taken: 'All remaining birds were culled'.

Describes what the declaration provides: 'provides resources for tracking, monitoring and the rapid detection'.
